reviewText: This concert is awesome!!!. They put on a hell of a show in London. It's a big deal to play Wembley and you can see the emotion come through in several moments during the show. Dave even cries a couple of times and becomes somewhat speechless, if you can believe that!
summary: Foo Fighters are not my favorite, but
Title: N/A

reviewText: I would like to give this disc a solid 4 stars but can only bring myself to give it 3. Why, you may ask? Well, sadly it's Grohl's foul mouth. I've spent my working life in garages,mills & factories so I'm well accustomed to swearing, & I can swear with the best of them when I'm really excited or angry, but that doesn't mean I like to hear it from entertainers who have no real reason to be cursing. I easily forgive the odd curse or two from anybody, but Grohl is one of these guys that can't complete a full sentence without dropping a f-bomb or two. Sad really, in an adult(he's not alone , we have an old acquaintance who's no better). I now know that the explicit advisory on the cover is well earned. 30 or so fewer f-bombs would have made this a much more enjoyable concert to watch. I suppose I'm in a minority with Foo Fighter fans but thought I should throw my 2 cents worth in there. I'll certainly watch this again but my finger won't be far from the ff button.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is an incredible and full of energy show. The video is fantastic, you see all the people that are far from the stage! I have a Infocus IN81 (1080p) projector and put on the wall in 130" . But I think they forgot to test the sound before recording the show. I have a Denon 2809. The sound has the fire of a live concert, but the drums, for example, could be far better. It could be a perfect show!!!

reviewText: All straight forward, live concert in one of the worlds largest stages. Thats all to it playing all their current hits.

reviewText: 3 hours of great rock.  The bank interacts with the crown and the British audience is incredible (I am from the US and have seen the FF and the UK fans just dance.  No violence - mosh pits - mashing ppl into the stage, etc).  After 2 hours John Paul Jones and Jimmy Page came out and jammed and that was incredible.  If you like rock and roll it is worth buying.  Excellent show.
summary: One of the greatest shows you will see

reviewText: It might be me, but he sounds better on the radio. Yells through alot of songs. Still had to give it 4 star because of the 4 songs i like alot here.
Title: N/A

reviewText: After a week and a half to finally get this from amazon I must say how disappointed in the sound on this was. Don't the people who produce this disc listen to the end result on how it sounds? Out of the more than 70 concert videos I own, this really is one of the worst! Having a really good system; dvds either sound great, or pretty bad, this was the latter! I actually gave this two stars instead of one because the picture was real good. With so many good dvds out there I was really surprised they didn't do a better job on the way the sound was done, this really takes the enjoyment out of watching this concert. Unfortunatly I'll be returning this back to amazon as defective.

reviewText: Wish there were bonus features... Just a straight up concert... Awesome though!  The Foo Fighters are what REAL Rock and Roll is!  The energy of the show comes through on this disc.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Yes, this is a must-have for Foo Fighter fans. Granted, it doesn't sound as well as the studio recordings, but it's not bad. Also, it's entertaining to hear a couple of the songs in a semi-unplugged state.The appearance of John Paul Jones (Led Zeppelin) and Jimmy Page (Led Zeppelin, The Yardbirds) for two songs is great. The concert is something that Dave Grohl says we'll be talking about for 20 years. He also says it's the best day of his whole  life. That says a lot about how much it means to him/them. Check it out.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've been a fan of the Foo Fighters since the beginning and I still find the first three albums to be the best. So when I saw a live performance of them from the legendary wembley stadium I knew it had to be great. Well while the performance was good I fell Dave is trying a little hard with his expansions in terms of the new sounds he's added. I myself prefer the songs without the addition of violin, pianos, and keyboards. However seeing the legendary Jimmy Page and John Paul Jones perform two of Led Zeppelins best songs with the Foo Fighters made up for this/ Overall a good concert, that for met at least falls just short of being great.
summary: Good Live Concert, But Not Great
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a very good recording of For Fighters live in concert. The videography captures each member of the band. The audio is crystal clear and realistic. I'm glad I bought this and watched it before I bought tickets to their live show. Now that I have seen them live, I know that buying a ticket would have been a big disappointment. They have two good songs; that's about it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: First of all, the video on this DVD is amazing, and produced to almost look like a movie.  Top notch quality on that.For the show, the energy in the band and the enormous croud never let down.  Watching it gave me chills.  Dave Grohl had some very funny moments talking inbetween songs (especially while introducing the band).  The special appearance of Jimmy Page and John Paul Jones was just icing on the cake. Overall it was a very inspirational show, and shows that rock and roll is not dead!!!This is a DVD you must get.

reviewText: Its sad the Foo Fighters have been around for so long and until now it seems like they finally are breaking thru. AMAZING DVD. I dont have any complaints about it. One of the best dvds i own and have watched in a long time, it leaves you with that wanting more and want to watch it over again. Def recommend for any rock fan
Title: N/A

reviewText: Overall, this is a near-great concert DVD - as the first reviewer said, "no frills" indeed (that's what i was also thinking while watching this)- there are no extras on this DVD but i'm not really complaining about that, as i seldom watch extras more than once anyway.  The band has great energy for such a large venue (and i've been fortunate to see them in clubs here in LA, and they brought the same energy to Wembley as they did to the Fonda here.  I was also at the filming of the acoustic Skin and Bones concert, and this DVD blows that one away - THIS Wembley DVD is the show you want).  My ONLY complaint with this DVD is that for many of the fast songs, there's too much MTV-style fast cutting, which almost induced motion sickness in me as it was simply too fast to follow on the large screen i watched it on.  Which is really a shame, because the camera work itself is stellar, some of the best close-up and composition work i've seen in a live concert DVD.  They got some really excellent angles/shots consistently....too bad they couldn't be content to just let the angles run for more than a second or two.  Sound is really good; setlist is good but everyone will complain something's missing (for me, it was "Let it Die" and "Summer's End").  The real cherry on the cake here is the Page-and-Jones appearance for two Zeppelin classics - Dave and Taylor can't contain their enthusiasm and it looks like everyone had a blast.  Overall, a great band, in excellent form, making for a fine DVD that is highly recommended.
summary: NEAR-GREAT, except for too-fast cuts/editing on some songs

reviewText: Arrived on time. Have watched several times and have enjoyed it every time. Big Foo fan.Sound and Picture are excellent.

reviewText: I saw the Foo Fighters this year at the Hard Rock in Las Vegas.  We were in the very front and the show was amazing.  I bought the DVD hoping it would be half as good as going to the show.  The songs played for the most part are the same as the concert I saw.  The footage is amazing and the sound is fantastic.  Watching the DVD is almost as good as seeing the band live, in one aspectic it is better as no one is spilling beer on you in the comfort of your own home.Get this DVD you will not be disappointed.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD is everything I could ask for from The Foo's! Their last DVD was more acoustic (which is great but you don't get the energy or power from it that the band has). This one one the other hand will knock your socks off! Add Jimmy Page and John Paul Jones of Led Zeppelin on a couple of their classics and you have a home run! Well worth the money if you are a Foo Fighters fan! Great seller, DVD was in brand new condition (still in shrink wrap) and arrived early! Two thumbs up.
Title: N/A
